title: Is it possible for cell phones to get crossed where phone calls and texts go to the wrong phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: The phone is identified by the Mobile Subscriber Identity (MSI) number, the last 10 digits of the 15 digit long International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) number. It can happen that, due to a glitch somewhere along the line, the number gets changed and the wrong phone gets alerted to a call, or gets a text,, but it’s extremely rare.

I believe yes.. a phone is not identified by its phone number, but by the IMEI number assigned to it. There are therefore a number of translations and looking up tables of data,so either a human error or even machine error can happen. Every time a translation is done,there is a possibility of error. In addition there are tricks of cloning phones,so these could mean that multiple devices would get the information intended for one.
